results.title: Hospital sepsis: a communicable disease
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Johnson and Johnson
results.brief_description: Reaffirms the need for stringent precautions against infection in hospitals in face of the present over-reliance on antibiotics. After briefly tracing the history of anti-sepsis in hospitals, a detailed case study of the spread of bacteria from an infected patient pinpoints the major spreaders, reservoirs and multipliers or organisms.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Johnson and Johnson

results.title: The Individual
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Instructions in methods of preventing communicable diseases associated with improper food handling. Illustrates habits that should be avoided by cooks and waitresses including dirty clothes and hands, untidy hair, and handling of the eating surface of crockery and cutlery.

results.title: Serving food
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Emphasises principles of food preparation and service in hospitals - proper temperature, correct quality, selection of food to meet patient’s requirements, and courteous attention buy food service personnel.

results.title: Introduction
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Introduces some main features of hospital food organisation: varied deparments, their equipment, and the over-all system of menu planning. Shows the general arrangements of food preparation used in hospitals.

results.title: Equipment
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Instructions on how to clean kitchen equipment; loosen, dissolve and emulsify dirt; rinse and dry equipment; and prevent food poisoning.

results.title: Horse talk
results.creator_credit: Paul Barralet and Paul Barralet Productions
results.brief_description: The various ways in which the horse still plays an active part in British life. Dray horses, horses on the farm, thoroughbreds and ponies for sport, and many others. The ceremonial horse being trained for the intricate pattern of ancient customs and great occasions which are part of Britain’s tradition. Commentary by James McKechnie.

results.title: Horse on holiday
results.creator_credit: Astrid Henning-Jensen, Bjarne Henning-Jensen, Government Film Committee of Denmark and Laterna Film
results.brief_description: A tour of Denmark with a difference. A milkman and his horse take a young American girl around Denmark, camping in the milkcart. They visit Kronborg, wander thorugh villages and countryside, stay at a farmhouse, meet up with a university student, cross by ferry from island to island, and return to Copenhagen, the King’s palace, the Tivoli gardens and the milk round.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Astrid Henning-Jensen, Bjarne Henning-Jensen, Government Film Committee of Denmark and Laterna Film

results.title: Horse latitudes
results.creator_credit: Peter Rowe, Tony Hall, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Clearwater Films and Rosebud Films
results.brief_description: Entrapped by his own reckless boastfulness, goaded by desire for glory at any price, a yachtsman falsifies radio signals and his ship’s log during a round the world solo race. A superbly photographed and constructed drama.

results.title: Hors d'oeuvre = Hors-d'oeuvre
results.creator_credit: Arthur Lipsett, Derek Lamb, Gerald Potterton, Jeffrey Hale, Kaj Pindal, Robert Verrall, Colin Low, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A collection of short cartoons produced by NFB animators. One-minute clips for government sponsors provide an amusing, fast-paced sampling of animation techniques. Among them are reminders about television programs, traffic safety rules, and the Department of Labour’s admonition, “Why wait for spring? Do it now.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Lipsett, Derek Lamb, Gerald Potterton, Jeffrey Hale, Kaj Pindal, Robert Verrall, Colin Low, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
